Is-space-exploration-worth-it-.title: Is space exploration worth it?
Is-space-exploration-worth-it-.description: When ice caps are melting away, cities are drowning, and natural disasters are intensifying, many do not understand why space exploration should be pursued. There is nothing better than winter break to celebrate the holidays, spend time with family and finally get to relax. However, when winter break gets too long, students begin to experience  disadvantages. 
A lot of students at South want the break to be longer, but I don’t agree that’s a good idea.

In study hall and classrooms, students have Chromebooks propped open as they type away earnestly. With the implementation of the 1:1 Learning Initiative starting with the class of 2021, the seniors were left out of the program. But this year, they also received Chromebooks.

Going-with-friends--alternative-to-covet.title: Going with friends: alternative to coveted prom dates
Going-with-friends--alternative-to-covet.description:
Prom season is here and along with it comes the stress of finding a dress, buying a corsage, and finding a date. Students have the option to go alone or with friends, but even then, many people still feel pressured to go with a date.

Editorial--how-to-keep-bathrooms-clean.title: Editorial: how to keep bathrooms clean
Editorial--how-to-keep-bathrooms-clean.description:
As you walk into the South bathrooms, you might notice a wet puddle. Maybe you’ll notice the stench of unflushed toilets, or the decaying passes left in the stalls. Maybe you’ll even notice someone walking out of the bathroom after they failed to take the time to wash their hands.

Your favorite media franchise is being brought to the movies. That should be something to rejoice over, right? Well, not necessarily.

False-information--why-vaccines-are-nece.title: False information: why vaccines are necessary
False-information--why-vaccines-are-nece.description:

Celebrity-health-advertisements.description:

Editorial--If-you-are-parking-in-the-Sou.description:
Honking, revving engines, and blasting music: the symphony of the South parking lot at the end of the school day. The madness of students trying to leave the school parking lot at the end of the day can lead to dangerous and expensive consequences.

Chivalry-redefined.title: Chivalry redefined
Chivalry-redefined.description:
Should men have to pay on a first date? If he does, is he being chivalrous or sexist? If a woman suggests they split the bill, is she a flaming feminist or just paying her share?

Morals-of-musicians.title: Morals of musicians
Morals-of-musicians.description:
There are no perfect role models.

The holidays are a time for family and friends to get together and have fun. Most importantly, it’s a time for everyone to take a break and relax.

Is-it-better-to-stay-at-home-during-the-.description:

Merry-Christmas-vs-Happy-Holidays.title: Merry Christmas vs Happy Holidays
Merry-Christmas-vs-Happy-Holidays.description:
A person is standing in line at a store paying for their goods. As they walk out of the store, goods in hand, the cheery cashier says a hearty “Merry Christmas.” Should the person be offended?

Dolce-and-Gabbana-advertisements--insens.title: Dolce and Gabbana advertisements: insensitive or not?
Dolce-and-Gabbana-advertisements--insens.description:
“In this room, we will not tolerate the use of any words or actions that put down people because of their race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or disability.” This motto hangs in classrooms in our high school, encouraging students to be accepting and respectful of others.

Consumerism-is-ruining-holidays-in-Ameri.title: Consumerism is ruining holidays in America
Consumerism-is-ruining-holidays-in-Ameri.description: During holidays in America, companies experience massive increases in sales as consumers flood stores to find gifts for friends and family. Shelves are filled with cards and decorations, and a price is put on the holiday spirit. But this practice undermines the whole point of the holidays.

New-Year-s-resolutions-don-t-work.title: New Year’s resolutions don’t work
New-Year-s-resolutions-don-t-work.description:
With a new year comes new resolutions. Some make a resolution to start going to the gym more; some that they will improve their diets; others to get eight hours of sleep. The first days of the New Year is a time to work towards the “better you.”

View-from-the-crow-s-nest--the-Kavanaugh.title: View from the crow’s nest: the Kavanaugh trial
View-from-the-crow-s-nest--the-Kavanaugh.description:
In 1991, Anita Hill, a Yale Law School graduate, came forward with sexual harassment claims against the Supreme Court nominee Clarence Thomas. Less than two weeks after her testimony, Thomas was sworn in as Supreme Court Justice.

Is-cultural-appropriation-for-Halloween-.title: Is cultural appropriation for Halloween costumes okay? – Pro
Is-cultural-appropriation-for-Halloween-.description:
For the longest time, I despised Halloween. I’d see costumes of people standing at my door waiting for candy: a Caucasian girl dressed as Pocahontas, an Indian girl sporting dreads and dressed as Michonne from The Walking Dead, a young boy dressed as Barack Obama wearing blackface.

Is-cultural-appropriation-for-Halloween-.description:

Puerto-Rico-remains-attempting-to-recove.title: Puerto Rico remains attempting to recover from devastating hurricanes
Puerto-Rico-remains-attempting-to-recove.description: Two hurricanes ravaged the Caribbean U.S. territory of Puerto Rico in the late summer of 2017. New Jersey could be on its way to becoming a Republican state.

Test-optional-schools--looking-beyond-te.description: Every year students scramble to find the best tutors and textbooks to guide them through the biggest obstacle course known to any high schooler: the dreaded SAT.
